quote_first: We have three years of the past to discuss. Let that suffice until
quote_last: , when we start upon the notable adventure of the empty house.
title: The Empty House
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote_first: Grant opened his eyes. Brilliant blue light was streaming into the building through the bars of the gate. Quartz light: the power was back on! Groggily, he looked at his watch. It was just
quote_last: . He’d been asleep only a couple of minutes.
title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton

quote_last: . Roxy was supposed to have gone over to her cousins that night; it had been arranged for weeks, but she’d given her mum lip about not getting her the right tights from Primark, so her Mum said, ‘You’re not going, you’re staying in’.
title: The Power
author: Naomi Alderman

quote_last: he started letting them win, lets them win it all back so fast they don’t hardly remember losing. He pays out the last couple of cigarettes and lays down the deck and leans back with a sigh and shoves the cap out of his eyes, and the game is done.
title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest
author: Ken Kesey

quote_last:
he was sitting on the edge of his bed looking at his watch. He put it to his ear. Then his lips drew back from his teeth in that curious wolf-like smile characteristic of the man. He said very softly:
“I think the time has come to do something about this.”
title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie

title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time
author: Mark Haddon

quote_first: Forty-eight years old, profoundly asleep at
quote_last: on a Friday night - this is modern professional life.
title: Saturday
author: Ian McEwan

quote_last: already. I’ve gotta head uptown for my appointment with Pavel. Pavel is my shrink. He sees patients at night. He’s a Czech Jew, a survivor of Terezin and Auswitz. I see him once a week.
title: Maus
author: Art Spiegelman

quote_first: The light in Mr. Green’s kitchen snapped off at
quote_last: , followed by the light in his bedroom at his usual ten o'clock. His house was the first on the street to go dark.
title: A crime in the neighborhood
author: Suzanne Berne
